definition[0]: the discussions held between employers and a union in order to reach agreement on wages, working conditions etc
definition[1]: the discussions held between an employer and a TRADE UNION in order to reach an agreement on wages and working conditions
example[0]: Contract workers fall outside collective bargaining agreements.
example[1]: This ballot is about the right of our members to have their pay determined by free collective bargaining (=not controlled by the government or legal rules).
